Load More Elevate your senses and mark your calendars for an unparalleled celebration as ArtFest Fort Myers prepares to illuminate the Fort Myers waterfront in grandeur for our 25th Anniversary. Embark on an artistic journey amidst the creations of over 200 meticulously chosen artists, savor the melodies of live entertainment, tantalize your taste buds with culinary delights, engage in immersive children's art activities, and be mesmerized by captivating live art demonstrations. Nestled against the breathtaking backdrop of Downtown Fort Myers, where the riverfront meets the yacht basin, this enchanting art extravaganza promises an unforgettable experience. Prepare to be enthralled—start planning your unforgettable visit today! Join us on: Friday, February 6, from 6 to 9 pm Saturday, February 7, from 10 am to 5 pm Sunday, February 8, from 10 am to 4 pm For more information, please visit our website: artfestfortmyers.com Load Less 26.645894, -81.870684 ArtFest Fort Myers 239-768-3602 1375 Jackson St. Suite 401 Fort Myers , FL 33901 United States Juan.Santiago@ArtFestFortMyers.com View Website Add to Calendar 2026-02-06 18:00:00 2026-02-06 21:00:00 ArtFest Fort Myers 2026 Elevate your senses and mark your calendars for an unparalleled celebration as ArtFest Fort Myers prepares to illuminate the Fort Myers waterfront in grandeur for our 25th Anniversary.

Embark on an artistic journey amidst the creations of over 200 meticulously chosen artists, savor the melodies of live entertainment, tantalize your taste buds with culinary delights, engage in immersive children's art activities, and be mesmerized by captivating live art demonstrations.

Nestled against the breathtaking backdrop of Downtown Fort Myers, where the riverfront meets the yacht basin, this enchanting art extravaganza promises an unforgettable experience. Prepare to be enthralled—start planning your unforgettable visit today!

Join us on:


	Friday, February 6, from 6 to 9 pm
	Saturday, February 7, from 10 am to 5 pm
	Sunday, February 8, from 10 am to 4 pm

Coconut Point Art Festivals share this Sanibel Island Arts & Crafts Fair ArtFest Fort Myers 0 comments Posted  | 0 comments Name: ArtFest Fort Myers Dates: February 1 & 2, 2025 (the first weekend in February every year), with preview on Friday night, January 31 Hours: From 6-9 p.m. on Friday, January 31 From 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. on Saturday and 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. on Sunday Place: ArtFest Fort Myers takes place along the banks of the Caloosahatchee River along Edwards Drive from Jackson to Heitman Street. This is part of downtown Fort Myers’ historic River District , where inventors and industry pioneers Thomas Edison, Henry Ford and Harvey Firestone once worked and played. In fact, festival goers can enjoy D.J. Wilkins’ sculpture and fountain dedicated to these three Uncommon Friends at the entrance to Centennial Park. Also on display within the festival grounds are Fort Myers’ historically-significant sculpture, Clayton , a monument dedicated to the 2nd Regiment of the USCT (United States Colored Troops), who defended Fort Myers from a Confederate attack on February 20, 1865; the Buckingham & Paige Army Air Field Monument;  the Florida Panthers in the median on Monroe Street; Columbian artist Edgardo Carmona’s Cor-Ten steel sculpture Nostalgic Tune on the Radio; and more than 40 murals on the concrete stanchions that surround the river basin which tell the story of Fort Myers historic relationship to the Caloosahatchee River. Festivalgoers can learn about the artists who created each sculpture and mural, as well as the stories they tell, by downloading a free phone app called Otocast, which contains text, historic photos and an audio about the artwork. The festival takes place in the shadow of the 12-story 243-room Luminary Hotel, which is part of the prestigious Autograph Collection of Marriott International. Inside, guests and visitors will find five featured food and beverage outlets – Ella Mae’s Diner, Dean Street Coffee, the Lobby Bar, and the hotel’s signature Silver King Ocean Brasserie and Beacon Social Drinkery rooftop lounge. Festival goers will also notice that the former Harborside Event Center has been completely renovated and renamed. It now goes by the moniker of Caloosa Sound Convention Center & Amphitheater. Not only is the Luminary mere blocks from the art galleries, trendy boutiques, retail shops and savory restaurants that populate Fort Myers’ historic, but completely refurbished , downtown, it overlooks a 1.8 acre basin that does more than provide a unifying, visual hub for the hotel, convention center and surrounding retail shops, galleries and restaurants. The basin actually serves the utilitarian function of filtering and cleaning the stormwater that runs off from the surrounding 15-acre hardscape before it joins the waters of the Caloosahatchee River and downriver estuaries. Awards and Recognition. ArtFest Fort Myers was chosen in October of 2013 as the “Best OVERALL REGIONAL Art Fair” in Southwest Florida in a survey conducted by ArtFairCalendar.com , the #1 website for art fair event listings. Whereas Sunshine Artist Magazine and Art Fair Insider rank festivals based on voting by “art fair insiders” such as artists and show staff, the America’s Best Art Fairs Awards are predicated on online voting by artists, organizers and art fair patrons and collectors, both regionally and nationally. As such, it is the first national online survey of the nation’s art fairs designed to reward those festivals that excel at creating opportunities that bring together artists and communities to celebrate the arts. “ArtFest Fort Myers has always been popular among art fair lovers in Southwest Florida, but our new national Best Art Fairs Awards survey proves that both art collectors and artists nationwide love it, too,” said ArtFairCalendar.com Publisher Connie Mettler in announcing the award. “We’re happy to give a “Best OVERALL/REGIONAL Art Fair Award to ArtFest Fort Myers today.” Please scroll down for articles on the numerous additional awards that ArtFest has garnered in recent years. VIP Opening Night Party. The opening night of ArtFest is more than just a tantalizing preview. It’s time Symphony on the Sounds and the ArtFest VIP Opening Night Party inside ArtFest’s glowing VIP garden tent, where the conversation is lively, the laughter raucous, and delectable treats, great wines and spirits are provided by some of the area’s finest restaurants. “When we open on Friday night, we are really proud of the fact that the Gulf Coast Symphony performs a free Pops Concert,” said Festival Director Sharon McAllister. This is the third year that Gulf Coast Symphony has opened ArtFest Fort Myers. Symphony founder and Music Director Andrew Kurtz explains why this year is special. “The Gulf Coast Symphony is doing a Broadway concert as part of the opening night festivities of the 25 th anniversary of ArtFest, which also coincides with our 30 th anniversary.” Limited seating will be provided. Personal chairs and blankets are allowed. The VIP experience doesn’t end when the concert and party are over. The VIP pass is good for all three days, and comes with reserved parking, access to the VIP Terrace overlooking the festival grounds, and complimentary lunch, all-day beverages and refreshments on Saturday and Sunday, and the gift of a commemorative festival poster. The VIP Experience is $135 per person and your support contributes to the year-round ArtFest Fort Myers’ art education outreach programs. To enjoy the ArtFest Fort Myers VIP Experience and the 200 artists as a Very Important Patron visit Upgrade To VIP at ArtFestFortMyers.com or call 239-768-3602. The Festival. More than 90,000 people attend ArtFest over the course of its three-day run. Both the serious art lover and novice collector will find ArtFest Fort Myers the perfect place to learn about the world of art and add to or begin a unique collection as 211 artists from 39 different states display paintings in oil and acrylic, watercolors, drawings in pastels, charcoal, pen and ink and graphite, 2D and 3D mixed media works and collages, photography and digital artworks, bronze and metal sculpture, wood working, ceramics, pottery, glass fusion and glass art, hand-crafted art jewelry, leather works and more. These are the best of the best, as nearly 1,200 artists apply each year for inclusion in this juried show, and many of these artists are seldom seen in Southwest Florida – their art is fresh and new. The organizers have laid out the artists’ booth in such a way as to create a circular flow of foot traffic down a wide central mall that engenders a beautiful, stress-free, open-air art gallery overflowing with exceptional artwork. Continuous music and the aromatic smells of succulent foods add to the festival experience. ArtFest Fort Myers strives to create a balanced show that fairly represents diverse styles, methodologies and techniques in the various categories just mentioned. In order to achieve this result, artists are selected based upon quality of workmanship, originality and artistic conception, and all work is required to be created soley by the displaying artists. Cost: ArtFest is free. Parking: The City of Fort Myers is well equipped to handle the large crowds attracted to ArtFest with a mixture of free and pay parking lots. You can expect to pay $4 to park in one of three city parking garages; $5 to park in various general and church lots; and $10 to park in the parking lot adjoining the Harborside Event Center which is closest to the festival grounds. However, a medley of free lots and parking garages are within easy walking distance (4-6 blocks) including the Lee County Justice Center Parking Garage which is the home of Parallel Park , a 30,000 square foot public art installation that looks so stunning people often confuse it for a fine art museum. Organizer: The festival is organized by ArtFest Fort Myers, Inc., a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization. The organization’s mission is the creation of public access to a broad array of visual art; nurturing the development and understanding of diverse art forms; supporting arts in education and encouraging the appreciation of the arts in Southwest Florida. Its staff actively attends meetings of the Greater Fort Myers Chamber, the Southwest Florida Attractions Association, the Tourist Development Council, and the Fort Myers City Council to provide support and input in its areas of expertise. Festival Director: With business degrees from the University of Hawaii and the University of Chicago, ArtFest Executive Director Sharon McAllister became a part of the Lee County community upon her early retirement at the age of 39. Her experience as a Divisional Vice President with H&R Block quickly transitioned into active local community service. In 2000, Sharon took over the existing “Lee Sidewalk Arts & Crafts Show” at the request of City of Fort Myers Downtown Redevelopment Director Don Paight, who asked her to form a not-for-profit organization and transform this annual event into ArtFest Fort Myers, a juried fine art festival. Under her tutelage, this event has quickly gained national recognition, while bringing an unparalleled art experience to the community. Among her credits are Past Chair of the City of Fort Myers Public Art Committee; Past President of the Fort Myers Conference & Convention Council; and 3 years as the Vice Chair of the Florida Festival and Events Association (FFEA). Website: http://www.artfestfortmyers.com . Fast Facts : ArtFest uses a “blind jury”. This means the jurors do not know the names or any other information about the artists. There are five jury members. Each is an experienced art professional who is selected for his/her art background and appreciation of festival artists. The five member panel is convened in the same room, and each juror is given access to a computer monitor for scoring purposes. Artist images are projected digitally (image size is 3 feet by 3 feet), shown simultaneously and scored on a seven point scale. ArtFest Fort Myers maintains an online gallery, which it updates in October, of the artists accepted for the upcoming festival! There are links to the artists’ websites, which you visit to find more information or view additional artwork. ArtFest Fort Myers and Florida SouthWestern State College work together to provide an art experience through after-school programs for elementary students. This collaborative project brings art alive for hundreds of students and develops innovative teachers for the future. ArtFest also sponsors “Art Under 20,” an art competition and exhibition open to Lee County high school students. The program not only provides them a huge platform in which to showcase their talents, but $6,000 in cash prizes for the very best student artists. Kids@Art, a collaborative effort of ArtFest Fort Myers and The Lee County Alliance For The Arts , helps eager “weekend artists” of all ages to tap into their best creative selves. ArtFest provides the supplies and supervision to all who wish to make an artistic treasure to take home. ArtFest also provides a “kids only” shopping zone called “The Young Art Collectors Gallery.” Filled with wonderful items donated by festival artists, the gallery is the perfect place for children ages 6 to 12 to purchase artwork for only $5. The “kids only” shopping zone is a brilliant concept that fosters the development of future art patrons with an emphasis on fun. During the festival, Florida Repertory Theatre, Southwest Florida Symphony Youth Orchestra, and Celtic Arts dancers will be showcasing their talent in a series of free performances taking place on the Youth Stage. If you’ve been wondering if your youngster has a calling to be a violin virtuoso or a trumpet player in the marching band, the Southwest Florida Symphony will be on hand with their Petting Zoo, where getting bit by the music bug is your only worry. A variety of musical instruments will be available for all to play, with expert instruction on hand, courtesy of the Youth Symphony members. The ArtFest staff actively attends meetings of the Visitor & Convention Bureau, the Fort Myers City Council, the Greater Fort Myers Chamber of Commerce, the Southwest Florida Attractions Association and the Tourist Development Council to provide support and input in its areas of expertise. As one of the community’s most popular and respected arts organizations, ArtFest believes it has a responsibility to be involved in the success of art and culture throughout the area. “We are members or attendees and supporters of all the arts organizations in Lee County.” _____________________________________________________ ARTICLES AND LINKS. ArtFest, Naples National and Bonita National among top 50 national art festivals (06-22-16) The votes are in, and according to the thousands who responded to ArtFairsCalendar.com’s annual nationwide survey, ArtFest Fort Myers , Bonita Springs National Art Festival and Naples National Art Festival landed in the top 50 of their “must attend” outdoor art festivals and fine craft shows year in and year out! These three local festivals join such renowned Florida shows as the Las Olas Art Fair in Fort Lauderdale, Mount Dora Art Festival in Mount Dora, Coconut Grove Arts Festival in Miami, Winter Park Sidewalk Art Festival outside Orlando, and Art Basel in Miami Beach. Naples National was the #2 “Best Southern Art Fair” with ArtFest Fort Myers garnering #5. Among the criteria the respondents used to judge their finalists were quality of art (48%), venue setting & ambiance (12%), affordability/wide price range (10%), family friendly/kids activities (10%), number of exhibitors (8%), location, accessibility & parking (6%), variety of media (4%) and good food & music (4%). Nearly one-third of the survey-takers said they have attended between 11 and 25 art fairs over the last five years, with 26.59% having attended 6-10, 21.36% having attended 1-4, and 19.09% saying they’ve attended more than they can count over the five-year timeframe. The average age of the respondents was 59, with 72% being female. Of additional interest, the average income of the respondents was $127,843 with 46% of the survey-takers having either a law or masters degree and 42% having some post-graduate education. ArtFairCalendar survey went out to over 50,000 e-newsletter subscribers and via Facebook last October with voting running into November. In all, ArtFairCalendar received completed surveys from nearly 2,000 voters. “Amazingly, 87% of the respondents completed the entire survey and followed all the prompts,” noted ArtFairCalendar Publisher Connie Mettler. “No ‘cat herding’ was necessary.” Voting was heaviest in the South and Mid-West. Kudos to Naples National, ArtFest Fort Myers and Bonita Springs National Art Festival. _______________________________________________ ArtFest Fort Myers received Chrysalis Award for Cultural Achievement (05-27-16) On May 20, ArtFest Fort Myers received the highly-coveted Chrysalis Award for Cultural Achievement by the Visitor & Convention Bureau and the Greater Fort Myers Chamber of Commerce Chrysalis Award for Cultural Achievement. The other nominees in the Cultural Achievement category were the Edison & Ford Winter Estates, Gulf Coast Leisure Movement, the Lee County Alliance for the Arts, Painting with a Twist and the Southwest Florida Symphony Orchestra & Chorus Association. Chico’s FAS (Business Development) and Florida Gulf Coast University’s Colloquium program (Education) also won Chrysalis Award honors for their positive impact on the local community. “We are very proud to be recognized for our efforts in bringing residents, visitors and fabulous artists to our community,” said Sharon McAllister, ArtFest Fort Myers Executive Director.   “Art and cultural experiences are an important and integral part of this area’s quality of life and our event clearly brings a diversity of people together in celebration of the arts.” “We could not have won this honor without the support of local companies who are also dedicated to our community. Working closely with Jaxi Builders to bring the Allure Your Senses Exhibit, featuring 23 sculptures throughout downtown Fort Myers and with David Anderson, the Technology Management Guru, to provide the new App Fort Myers River District were two of this seasons  projects, in addition to our fine art festival, that we are most proud of. The success of our efforts is the result of the teamwork of many dedicated community members!” In all, 43 area attractions, accommodations, retailers, educational institutions, arts and cultural organizations, transportation companies, and other local businesses were nominated for Chrysalis Awards in six categories. The awards are designed to foster a stronger alliance between the tourism industry and the county’s business community. Chrysalis Award nominees are judged on innovation in their respective category, how they have distinguished themselves in the community, the results of their efforts to promote the destination, their contributions to business and tourism partnerships for the overall benefit of the county, and their work to foster growth and sustainability. Honorees are recognized for their commitment to excellence in improving community growth and creating job opportunities for the citizens of Lee County. ArtFest takes place the first weekend in February in the Fort Myers River District. Mark your calendar for February 3, 4 & 5, 2017 to join the experience with 215 professional artists from across the county and around the world; the largest high school art exhibit and competition in south Florida and free interactive art experiences for children of all ages. ___________________________________________________________ ArtFest wins six awards at international festival and events conference (09-23-15) Thousands of event professionals from around the globe gather at the International Festival & Events Association Convention in Tucson Arizona each year to learn, share and pay tribute to the accomplishments of those who demonstrate excellence. On September 21, ArtFest Fort Myers was honored with six awards at the conference. “It is an amazing honor to be acknowledged with six awards from IFEA,” states Sharon McAllister, ArtFest Fort Myers Executive Director. The categories in which ArtFest Fort Myers won awards include: Best Ad Series for promotional material for “Publix Run to the Arts,” featuring the work of local graphic designer Janine Giovianazzi from Dzine Studio; Best Event (within an Existing Festival) for “Publix Run to the Arts, an artsy 5K;” Best Single New Sponsorship Opportunity for Copa Di Vino, the Official Wine of ArtFest Fort Myers (Gold award); Best Single New Sponsorship Opportunity for CenturyLink, Socialize with Us (Silver award); Best Sponsor Partner for “Publix Super Markets, Publix Art Yard & Publix Run To The Arts;” and Best Sponsorship Program for Individual Sponsor for “Florida Blue, The Art of Health.” ArtFest Fort Myers takes place February 5, 6 & 7, 2016 in the Fort Myers River District. The 3-day event features 215 professional artists from across the county and around the world; the largest high school art exhibit and competition in south Florida; and free interactive art experiences for children of all ages. For more information, please visit ArtFestFortMyers.com . ____________________________________________________________ ArtFest winner of five Pinnacle Gold Awards (09-28-13) The International Festivals & Event Association (IFEA) paid tribute to ArtFest Fort Myers during the IFEA Pinnacle Awards Ceremony at IFEA’s 58th Annual Convention. ArtFest Fort Myers won 5 Gold Awards in the prestigious Pinnacle Awards Competition. Haas & Wilkerson Insurance presents the IFEA Pinnacle Awards Competition to recognize the outstanding accomplishments and top quality creative, promotional, operational and community outreach programs and materials produced by festivals and events around the world. It conferred Gold Awards to ArtFest in the following five categories: Best Event within an Event to Benefit a Cause: Pedal or Paddle to ArtFest Fort Myers sponsored by Lee Memorial Health System Best Targeted Sponsor Package: Chalk Block presented by Truly Nolen Pest Control Best Printed Material: TravelHost Magazine Special Edition Best Newspaper Insert/Supplement: Florida Weekly Wrapper Best T-Shirt Design Striving for the highest degree of excellence in festival and event promotions and production, 1,000 event professionals from every corner of the globe gather for the IFEA convention each year. ArtFest Fort Myers Executive Director, Sharon McAllister and Associate Director Katie Afflerback attended the three day IFEA Convention and look forward to implementing all they learned to continue to enhance ArtFest Fort Myers. Also attending the convention and receiving awards were: Kentucky Derby Festival, Pasadena Tournament of Roses, Des Moines Arts Festival and many more. “ArtFest Fort Myers would like to thank all of our sponsors, volunteers, artists, attendees and the City of Fort Myers for their support and devotion,” the festival stated in its press release announcing the awards. “We could never do it without you!” ArtFest Fort Myers takes place in beautiful downtown Fort Myers on February 1 & 2, 2014 with its opening night on January 31st. The event is expected to draw more than 80,000 art enthusiasts to the River District for the two-day, one-night event. For more information, please contact Sharon McAllister at 239-768-3602 or sharon.mcallister@artfestfortmyers.com . Leave a Reply Cancel reply Your email address will not be published. ArtFest@Home ALL-NEW for 2021, we are thrilled to announce ArtFest@Home . This virtual event will not replace the in-person Festival. The in-person and virtual Festival will exist alongside each other to create additional experiences and artwork sales for everyone. Virtual Festivals being creating on new, cutting edge platforms, like Eventeny, are vibrant; engaging; content packed and sales driven. Having a virtual component to art festivals is the way of the future. Certainly the virtual component will never replace the community joy of the in-person festivals. Think of the virtual component as opening new markets for your artwork and reaching buyers for more time than just a weekend. This is a quick look at ArtFest@Home All artists accepted to ArtFest Fort Myers are also in ArtFest@Home. No other artists will be in ArtFest@Home, only those accepted through the in-person festival jury process. There is no additional “booth fee” to be part of ArtFest@Home , it’s a package deal with the in-person festival. There will be plenty of tech support for artists, although if you can handle ZAPP or PayPal or your own eCommerce store you will love the ArtFest@Home interface. ArtFest Fort Myers will provide extensive assistance to artists to maximize their online sales at ArtFest@Home or any other virtual art show. There is more information about ArtFest@Home on How To Apply page and you can see the recording of the initial demos for artists August 12, 13 & 14 at ArtFestFortMyers.com/artist-resources . This demo only covered artist aspects of ArtFest@Home . There is so much more content being planned to make it engaging. Opening Night Opening Night is the Friday evening before the festival weekend. It’s a grand evening of fine art, fine food, and fine wine in an outdoor gallery setting. We have well over 700 VIPs in attendance that night in the VIP Party Tent — the heart of Opening Night. Opening Night takes place on the ArtFest Fort Myers festival site and features 65 artist booths plus background entertainment, food, and beverages. Friday evenings in downtown Fort Myers are special — so the crowds will be great! Opening Night hosts 5,000 patrons flooding the streets to take part in the festivities. Opening Night is attended by serious art buyers who are also your best prospective customers. Don’t miss out on this great selling opportunity. 2020 Program Cover Festival Program Be a star in the centerfold of our full-color Festival Program, with a distribution of 8,500 copies to festival patrons, sponsors and VIPs. Included with your artwork will be your name; your booth number and your website or email address. We will use your #1 from your ZAPPlication for the Festival Program. Contact us for more information about Festival Program opportunities. Poster Unveiling Party showcasing the Poster/T-shirt artist with media coverage and high-end buyers. Free booth space at ArtFest Fort Myers the year you’re the poster artist. Plus an invitation to join us at ArtFest Fort Myers the following year and much more! See examples of previous festival posters in our online store . All artists in ArtFest Fort Myers databases will be notified when we are open for entries, so be sure to sign up for email announcements. Information for the Artists | ArtFest Fort Myers MENU MENU About Contact MENU MENU Home Experiences Guide to the Festival FREE Pops Concert Fun for the Family Get VIP Access Dining Map, Directions, Parking Support Donate Become an ArtFest VIP Sponsors Volunteers Festival Store About the Artists Meet the Artists Online Gallery Shop For Artists Saturday and Sunday, February 7 & 8, 2026 Opening Night Friday, February 6, 2026 Artists like you come first at ArtFest Fort Myers! http://artfestfortmyers.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/2023-The-Artist-Experience-Video.mp4 We support artists and facilitate meaningful connections between artists and collectors. A two-day event with optional Opening Night on Friday attracts 90,000 attendees, including a loyal base of dedicated art buyers and VIP Club members focused on discovering and acquiring your artwork. Celebrating 25 years in 2025, ArtFest Fort Myers is a free, non-gated art festival featuring 200 artists in a picturesque setting overlooking the Downtown Fort Myers riverfront. New and cutting-edge art is equally at home with more traditional work. You'll find a strong market here: Fort Myers is the #1 fastest-growing of the 150 major cities in US News 2024's report on growth areas. This coastal city is home to a vibrant downtown and enjoys close proximity to the beautiful sandy beaches of Sanibel Island and Fort Myers Beach. The Fort Myers median age of 45 and strong new homes sales combined with the art loving attendees from neighboring cities of Naples & Sarasota created ArtFest Fort Myers as a prime destination for art enthusiasts and new homeowners seeking to enhance their living spaces. At this artist-friendly festival, we do everything we can to make your busy weekend as stress-free and rewarding as possible. Year-round professional staff with 25+ years of consistent management. Booths with 3ft between them. A convenient Friday setup with drive-up access. Reserved nearby artist parking including overnight RVs. Indoor bathrooms. Daily complimentary continental breakfast, coffee and water. Booth sitters and dedicated Artist Ambassadors. Professional overnight and daytime security. Discounted hotel rates. Commitment to accessibility, offering physical accommodations for artists with disabilities to ensure equal opportunities for participation. Support for artists who are new to selling at outdoor art festivals. Contact us for assistance. To make your experience at ArtFest Fort Myers even more rewarding, we promote the festival extensively and provide artists with promotional opportunities. We also offer valuable resources, webinars, and tips to help you navigate the evolving art market. We are passionate about supporting your success. Reach out with any questions - we value open communication with artists like you. Forbes Magazine rated Fort Myers/Cape Coral as #1 in population growth #10 in job growth with construction activity topping the charts! Welcome, Artists! ArtFest Fort Myers is Experiential Marketing at its Best By becoming an ArtFest sponsor, you'll gain a distinctive and targeted opportunity to reach over 90,000 consumers in a relaxed, personal, and buying-oriented environment. Call for Artists – ArtFest Fort Myers 2018 MENU MENU About Contact MENU MENU Home Experiences Guide to the Festival FREE Pops Concert Fun for the Family Get VIP Access Dining Map, Directions, Parking Support Donate Become an ArtFest VIP Sponsors Volunteers Festival Store About the Artists Meet the Artists Online Gallery Shop For Artists Saturday and Sunday, February 7 & 8, 2026 Opening Night Friday, February 6, 2026 Call for Artists – ArtFest Fort Myers 2018 June 27, 2017 by Megan Tramonte ArtFest Fort Myers, Southwest Florida’s premier fine art festival, is currently accepting applications from professional artists for participation in our 2018 juried show.  Featuring the work of 200 artists, ArtFest Fort Myers will bring 90,000 art lovers and collectors to the largest outdoor gallery in Southwest Florida on the first weekend in February! Why apply to participate at ArtFest Fort Myers?  Creating an artwork-selling festival for artists is the focus of our year-round professional staff, with 18 years of consistent management. Targeting art buyers throughout Southwest Florida and beyond – from Marco Island to Sarasota and east to West Palm Beach – our promotional campaign includes all forms of media. We also understand the importance of providing great artist amenities over festival weekend, to ensure that our artists are stress free and ready to share their work with our dedicated attendees. How are festival artists chosen?  Each October, ArtFest Fort Myers brings together a panel of professional artists who view submitted images and score each applying artist on a range of 1 – 7 points. The artists with the highest scores are then invited to participate in ArtFest. Our Jury Panel varies each year but always represents a broad base of expertise with regard to artistic mediums – theirs is the difficult task of evaluating who is the “best-of–the-best” from the hundreds of artists who wish to join ArtFest Fort Myers! (Our jury process is open to artists and patrons – please contact us for more information.) For Artist Application information, contact ArtFest Fort Myers at 239-768-3602, email info@ArtFestFortMyers.com or visit our Artist Info pages on our website at ArtFestFortMyers.com. Guide to Artfest Fort Myers | Find Your Ideal Experience MENU MENU About Contact MENU MENU Home Experiences Guide to the Festival FREE Pops Concert Fun for the Family Get VIP Access Dining Map, Directions, Parking Support Donate Become an ArtFest VIP Sponsors Volunteers Festival Store About the Artists Meet the Artists Online Gallery Shop For Artists Saturday and Sunday, February 7 & 8, 2026 Opening Night Friday, February 6, 2026 Guide to the Festival Immerse yourself in a world of extraordinary art and enjoyable activities for the entire family as you experience the vibrant Fort Myers downtown riverfront. Discover the work of over 200 artists from around the country and worldwide: paintings, sculptures, glasswork, ceramics, and more. From originals to limited reproductions, there's something for the serious art lover or a casual collector to enjoy. Indulge in delicious culinary treats and relax with music and family-friendly entertainment. Come yourself or bring your family and experience an unforgettable weekend. SAVE THE DATE: Opening Night, Friday, February 6, 2026, 6 to 9 pm Saturday, February 7. 2026, 10 am to 5 pm Sunday, February 8, 2026, 10 am to 4 pm Meet Our Carefully Selected Artists Only 1 in 5 artists who apply are invited to ArtFest Fort Myers. They travel from dozens of states across the U.S. You’ll find a treasure to call your own, regardless of your budget. Add to a favorite collection, or begin your art journey with your first art purchase. Learn more about the artists and visit the online art gallery to discover the beauty that's waiting for you at ArtFest Fort Myers. Don't Miss the FREE Opening Night! ArtFest's Opening Night is a feast for all your senses. Specialty lighting creates a bold backdrop as you shop and mingle with more than 60 of the festival's finest artists ... in a relaxed and intimate setting. Vibrant entertainment surrounds you as delectable food and fine drinks tempt your palette. Learn more about Opening Night. Enjoy the Symphony on the Sound Gulf Coast Symphony performs on Opening Night to bring you Symphony on the Sound , a free Pops Concert.  Featuring talented musicians from Southwest Florida this extraordinary performance will showcase popular hits that are sure to captivate and delight. Learn more. Presented by: Upgrade to the VIP Club Join the VIP Club and enjoy three days of exclusive benefits and convenient reserved parking just steps from the art festival entrance. VIP Club has a spectacular location in the heart of the art festival. The Opening Night Party, Weekend Brunch each day, complimentary beverages and reserved parking complete the package. Learn more and join the VIP Club! Publix Run to the Arts Start your Sunday with an invigorating run or walk and a healthy breakfast … then feed your mind and spirit at ArtFest Fort Myers. So much more than any ordinary 5K, the Publix Run to the Arts brings together the best that life has to offer: health and fitness, arts and culture, friends and family, and the scenic beauty of the Fort Myers waterfront. Post-race festivities include breakfast, race medals for the top finishers, and much more. Learn more or go ahead and register here. Publix Art Yard Publix Art Yard is filled with arts activities for everyone. An array of arts organizations — including Florida Repertory Theatre, Gulf Coast Symphony, Alliance for the Arts, Fort Myers Mural Society and Char-Lee Weavers — showcase their programs with hands-on activities. The Community Stage features continual performances by a wide variety of dancers, musicians, and other performing artists. Learn more about the Publix Art Yard. Art Under 20 Exhibit & Competition Art Under 20 is an expansive high school art exhibit and competition with 300+ high school artists competing for $10,000 in cash prizes. Admire these talented young artists' incredible work throughout the weekend in their professionally equipped and artistically lit 35 x 100 foot tent. See who won the prizes as a result of the blind-to-student name or school judging that took place behind closed doors on Friday evening. Learn more about Art Under 20. Chalk Block Enjoy watching 40+ teams from Lee County High Schools and professional chalk street painting artists create beautiful drawings at ArtFest Fort Myers — not on canvas but on the pavement. For most students this is their first time painting with chalk on the ground. You'll be amazed at their talent. The 2025 theme for student and professional artists was "Time to Shine." Stay tuned for the 2026 theme! Learn more about Chalk Block. Shop the Festival Store Each year the artwork of a ArtFest Fort Myers artist is featured on the Commemorative Poster & T-shirts. 2025 featured the incredible artistry of Christine Adele Arts. “Party of Two,” features two roseate spoonbills, painted against a vibrant abstract background. Order Yours Today! Volunteer with ArtFest Fort Meyers The art festival's enthusiastic weekend volunteers play a crucial role by welcoming attendees, assisting artists, and supporting various behind-the-scenes tasks. We offer a wide range of volunteer opportunities, and training will be provided to ensure you're equipped for your role. Each volunteer and their four-hour shift are essential to the smooth operation of ArtFest Fort Myers. Learn more and register to volunteer. Maps, Parking and Directions Getting to ArtFest Fort Myers is easy and there's plenty of parking in premium garages, city garages, and open lots. Plus FREE trolleys to tie it all together. There's even a free on-site bike valet in the heart of the festival! All the maps, directions, and other info you need are right here, along with hot tips to make it even easier. Get your maps, parking and directions here. SAVE THE DATE FOR 2026! Volunteers Make ArtFest Fort Myers Happen MENU MENU About Contact MENU MENU Home Experiences Guide to the Festival FREE Pops Concert Fun for the Family Get VIP Access Dining Map, Directions, Parking Support Donate Become an ArtFest VIP Sponsors Volunteers Festival Store About the Artists Meet the Artists Online Gallery Shop For Artists Saturday and Sunday, February 7 & 8, 2026 Opening Night Friday, February 6, 2026 Volunteers CLICK TO VOLUNTEER FOR 2026 Volunteers Make ArtFest Fort Myers Happen! ArtFest Fort Myers is only possible with our volunteers' incredible dedication and support. Our friendly and enthusiastic weekend volunteers play a vital role in creating a memorable experience for our guests and attendees. As a volunteer, you can greet and assist guests, support our talented artists, and contribute behind the scenes to ensure everything runs smoothly. Your contribution, no matter how big or small, is essential to the success of our festival. We value the commitment of our volunteers and want to ensure you feel prepared and confident in your role. That's why we provide comprehensive training to equip you with the necessary skills and knowledge for your volunteer position. And to show our appreciation, you'll receive a free volunteer t-shirt that you can proudly wear throughout the festival and keep as a memento of your valuable contribution. Join our dedicated team of volunteers and be part of the magic that brings ArtFest Fort Myers to life. Your time and effort will make a meaningful impact, and the memories and connections you make will last a lifetime. Festival Volunteer Positions Pre-Festival Decor Team (Thurs. and Friday) Beverage Sales Chalk Block Street Painting Support Team Publix Art Yard Kids Activities Guest Relations Team Merchandise Team (Posters and T-shirts) Artist Welcome Team We Are Overflowing Support Team And so much more Free Volunteer Perks ArtFest Fort Myers volunteer T-shirt Snacks and beverages at Volunteer Headquarters Volunteer Parking Opportunity to meet artists from around the country and the world Connect and have fun with fellow volunteers Help promote the arts in Southwest Florida Volunteers rave about ArtFest Fort Myers "Join the Best Volunteer Group and be a part of something amazing." "We adore the stylish T-shirts we receive each year." "Indulge in delicious snacks provided by the ArtFest team." "Working with talented artists is a delight — they bring so much fun and joy to the festival." "We Love ArtFest! It's my 11th year." Festival Weekend Information for Volunteers Please watch the training videos for your assigned area to prepare for the festival weekend. These videos will be posted here in January. We greatly appreciate your presence and request that you arrive promptly 20 minutes before your scheduled shift times. Volunteer Headquarters can be found at the Caloosa Sound Convention Center. The entrance for volunteers is located on the east side of the convention center, nearest to the Luminary Hotel on Edwards Drive. Look for the eye-catching red and yellow Welcome Flags and Volunteer Entrance signs. Volunteer Priorities At ArtFest Fort Myers, having fun is an integral part of volunteering. Safety is always our top priority, so we kindly ask that alcoholic beverages not be consumed while volunteering. Patience is also essential in ensuring a smooth and enjoyable experience for all. What to Wear Be sure to wear your free volunteer T-shirt, which will be provided during check-in. Dress comfortably for outdoor activities and pay attention to the weather forecast. If rain is predicted, we still need you, so consider bringing rain gear. Remember to apply sunscreen to protect yourself from the sun. Comfortable closed-toe shoes are a must since our festival site spans one mile, and you'll be on your feet. Purses? We recommend leaving your purse at home and opting for a fanny pack or alternative. Unfortunately, we don't have a secure place to store your valuables. Parking Reserved Volunteer Parking is available for you, and a convenient free trolley service will transport you to the Volunteer Check-In entrance. Volunteer Parking is at the Jury Parking Lot, across from the Fort Myers Police Building. Just follow the prominent green signs. Use the address: 2210 Widman Way, Fort Myers, FL 33901, for GPS navigation. Thank you for your invaluable contribution as a volunteer at ArtFest Fort Myers. We appreciate your commitment and look forward to a fantastic festival weekend together! The 60-person Steering Committee, in collaboration with dedicated ArtFest Fort Myers staff, diligently oversees all facets of the art festival to ensure its success. Contact us if you'd like to know more about serving on the Steering Committee. Many Thanks to ArtFest Supporting Sponsors Fort Myers Community Redevelopment Agency Supporting arts organizations, galleries and individual artists to create a community where companies and residents want to invest. This beloved annual event brings together over 200 exceptionally talented artists from across the country, showcasing a breathtaking array of artistic expressions. From the delicate brushstrokes of vibrant paintings to the intricate details of handcrafted sculptures, the festival offers a feast for the senses. Among the many talented artists gracing ArtFest Fort Myers 2025, you'll find the renowned Leon F. Ruiz, whose captivating paintings will undoubtedly mesmerize you. This is your opportunity to experience the unique vision of this esteemed artist firsthand, to engage with him about his creative process, and to potentially acquire a piece of his remarkable artwork for your own collection. Before you embark on your ArtFest adventure, we invite you to explore our online gallery. Browse through the diverse collection of artworks and identify those that particularly resonate with you. If you find a painting by Leon F. Ruiz that captures your imagination, we encourage you to contact us. We can assist you in making arrangements to view that specific piece at his exhibition during ArtFest Fort Myers 2025. ArtFest Fort Myers is more than just an art exhibition; it's a vibrant celebration of creativity and community. Immerse yourself in the festive atmosphere, enjoy live music performances that enliven the streets, and savor the delectable culinary delights offered by an array of food vendors and food trucks. Engage in interactive activities designed for all ages, creating lasting memories with family and friends. The festival's picturesque waterfront location provides a stunning backdrop for your artistic exploration, making your ArtFest experience truly unforgettable. Conveniently Located Parking and Easily Accessible ArtFest Fort Myers is conveniently located in downtown Fort Myers, offering easy access for art enthusiasts from throughout the region. Ample parking is available nearby, ensuring a smooth and enjoyable arrival and departure. Don't miss this extraordinary opportunity to support local artists, discover new and inspiring works of art, and experience the magic of ArtFest Fort Myers 2025. Meet the Artists in person As a juried art festival, we are choosy about the artists who come to ArtFest Fort Myers. Only 1 in 5 artists who apply are invited to exhibit here, and they hail from dozens of states across the U.S. ArtFest is an artist’s and art lover’s destination — right here in Fort Myers. Visit the Online Art Gallery and browse some quality work at this year’s ArtFest. And make plans to chat with our artists, up close and in person, as you discover beautiful, handcrafted pieces in every booth. Add to a favorite collection, or begin with your first art purchase. You’ll find a treasure to call your own, regardless of your age and budget. What does it mean to be a Juried Art Festival? Artists apply by submitting digital images of their artwork and booth display. A five-member panel of art professionals reviews and scores all entries. ArtFest staff members are not involved in the selection process — it is done exclusively by the panel. The artists whose entries score highest in each category are invited to exhibit at ArtFest Fort Myers. Artists are selected based on the quality of workmanship, originality, and artistic conception, to create a balanced and diverse show. All work must be created solely by the exhibiting artists. Juried art festivals work hard to maintain each event's quality and professional integrity. Exhibitors considered "importers" and "production houses" are not allowed to exhibit Explore ArtFest Artists Enjoy the work of hundreds of ArtFest artists from the past decade-plus, starting with the 2012 festival! ArtFest Fort Myers Launches Run To The Arts MENU MENU About Contact MENU MENU Home Experiences Guide to the Festival FREE Pops Concert Fun for the Family Get VIP Access Dining Map, Directions, Parking Support Donate Become an ArtFest VIP Sponsors Volunteers Festival Store About the Artists Meet the Artists Online Gallery Shop For Artists Saturday and Sunday, February 7 & 8, 2026 Opening Night Friday, February 6, 2026 ArtFest Fort Myers Launches Run To The Arts December 8, 2014 by Megan Tramonte WHAT: Publix Run To The Arts – an artsy 5K WHEN: February 8, 2015 • 7:30AM WHERE: ArtFest Fort Myers – Edwards Drive in front of Harborside Event Center WHO: All runners & walkers welcome PRICE: $25 – includes artsy T-shirt, breakfast, door prizes and more MORE INFO: RunToTheArts.com 5K. Run or walk, race or fun. At the one and only ArtFest Fort Myers. When announcing Publix Run to the Arts Sharon McAllister, ArtFest Fort Myers’ Executive Director said “This is so much more than any ordinary 5K. The first ever Publix Run To The Arts brings together the best that life has to offer: health and fitness, arts and culture, friends and family, and the scenic beauty of the Fort Myers waterfront. In our view it is all about quality of life in our community”. Publix Run to the Arts isn’t just a race, it’s a full morning of fun that kicks off Sunday morning at ArtFest Fort Myers with exceptional art, entertainment, and children’s art activities. Runners and their guests will enjoy live music and be the first to sneak a peek at the artist booths on Sunday morning, even before the festival opens to the public.  Join the fun at the Silk Experience as dynamic silk painting artists invite runners to exercise their creativity and create group silk paintings. Post-race festivities include a scrumptious breakfast, a chance to make art at the Silk Experience, race awards, live entertainment, fabulous door prizes, and much more. Take part in a new Fort Myers tradition, participate in the Publix Run To The Arts! When learning of ArtFest’s newest event Tamara Pigott, Executive Director Visitor & Convention Bureau said “It makes perfect sense to blend fitness, well-being, and the arts with our natural surroundings.  The inaugural Publix Run To The Arts will showcase our waterfront.  This is especially fitting, as it is the great beauty of our waters, that has inspired so many artistic endeavors in the past.  We, at the VCB, look forward to helping this event thrive as a new Fort Myers tradition.” Publix Run To The Arts registration fee guarantees a spot in the race as well as all of these runners-only goodies: Run to the Arts t-shirt, with beautiful art by wildly popular 2014 ArtFest Fort Myer Poster artist, Tara Funk Grim.  Register by December 19 to reserve your size! Post-race breakfast, featuring tasty Publix treats – muffins & bagels with all the trimmings; bananas & bananas; yogurt; coffee and a few surprises. Medals will be given for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place in each age group, plus special awards for male and female overall, masters, grand masters, and senior masters. Door prizes including weekends for two at South Seas Resort, Inns of Sanibel; Garmin GPS watch; Brooks running shoes; Theater and symphony tickets; Art classes; gift certificates for great meals and excursions and so much more. Free runners-only parking will be available at West First Street and Carson Street. Park all day and enjoy ArtFest! Professional bib timing services by 3D Racing, provides results posted as soon as the race is finished. Being one of the first organizations to start assembling a race team Lydia Black, Executive Director Alliance for the Arts said “Sports and Arts are both key ingredients of the health and vitality of our communities and the people who live in them. It’s great to see these two important activities coming together in one event to celebrate health, wellness, play and creation!” Publix Run To The Arts welcomes non-runners as race day volunteers! All volunteers will get a cool Publix Run To The Arts staff shirt, breakfast on race day, raffle entry, and preferred parking. Run to the Arts is made possible by the generous support of Publix a 12 year sponsor of ArtFest Fort Myers who is carrying on its tradition of being the kind of company a community can count on. Publix invites you to start your day with an invigorating run or walk and a healthy breakfast … then feed your mind and spirit at ArtFest Fort Myers. ArtFest Fort Myers, the annual juried fine art festival, takes place February 6, 7 & 8, 2015 in the Fort Myers River District. Join the experience with 215 professional artists from across the county and around the world; the largest high school art exhibit and competition in south Florida and free interactive art experiences for children of all ages. For more information visit RunToTheArts.com or connect with the race or the art festival on Facebook  and Linkedin.   #artfestfm   #artfestrun Many Thanks to ArtFest Supporting Sponsors Babcock Ranch America’s first solar-powered town provides a whole new way of life. Learn more about ArtFest Fort Myers. Deadlines & Fees Application Fee: $35 Booth Fees Single 10 x 10 is $485 + 6.5% Florida Sales Tax Premium Single 10 x 10 is $585 + 6.5% Florida Sales Tax Double 10 x 20 is $970 + 6.5% Florida Sales Tax Premium Double 10 x 20 is $1,070 + 6.5% Florida Sales Tax Double 10 x 20 End Cap is $1,170 + 6.5% Florida Sales Tax Deadlines May 9, 2025: Application available on ZAPPlication September 19, 2025: Application deadline September 26 to October 8, 2025: Jury Days October 17, 2025: Invitations sent November 18, 2025: Acceptance by artist due November 18, 2025: Booth fees due December 12, 2025: Withdrawal date without forfeiture of booth fee January 5, 2026: Artist certificate of insurance due February 6, 2026: Artist setup, with staggered assigned load-in times beginning at 7:30 am February 6, 2026: Opening Night, including approximately 65 festival artists from 6 p.m. to 9 p.m. Participation is optional when invited by ArtFest Fort Myers February 7, 2026: ArtFest Fort Myers, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. February 8, 2026: ArtFest Fort Myers, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Return to top Selection Process ArtFest Fort Myers strives to create a balanced show that represents diverse styles and techniques in the categories defined below. Artists are selected based upon quality of workmanship, originality and artistic conception. All work must be done solely by the displaying artists. ArtFest Fort Myers takes seriously its responsibility to exclude work not done by the artist - such as production house work or buy-sell work. ArtFest Fort Myers uses a monitor jury either as an in-town group or remotely. The jury is a "blind jury." This means the jurors do not know the names or any other information about the artists. ArtFest Fort Myers uses Zapplication to administer its application and jury process. Artist images can be viewed simultaneously or individually, in the order the artist uploads them to ZAPP. The booth image is always on the right (last in the series). Artist images are scored on a seven-point scale. Jurors can't use the 4 forcing them to "get off the average fence". The jurors, a diverse group of 5 experienced art professionals, are selected for their art background and for their appreciation of the value of art festivals. Our jury members vary each year and a festival artist is often included on this panel. Ninety percent (90%) of the artist spaces will be selected through the jury process. The Best of Show Artists and 2025 Poster Artists have automatic acceptance to ArtFest Fort Myers 2026. The art festival also has the ability to invite artists of our choice. We expect, based on history, approximately 180 artists will be selected in the Jury Process with the remaining 20+/- being award winners, poster artists or invitees. A waitlist, by category based on jury scores, will be established for each art medium of the festival. Images from accepted artists will be utilized for promotion and adherence to the rules. The decision of the jury is final. Examples of Accepted Art For more examples, see the online gallery. (All accepted artists are featured there.) TIPS FOR GREAT SUBMISSIONS Please check out the Artists Tips for some helpful tips on creating a good artwork submission. We also encourage artists to take advantage of Mock Jury online or in-person to create the strongest applications to any art festival. Your artwork images should fill the 1920 x 1920 space available and be cropped well to showcase your artwork. Backgrounds for 3D artwork should enhance not distract from your artwork. Booth image should show your booth as it is set up for an outdoor or indoor show with your work displayed, but must not reveal the artist name or have people standing in the booth . The Image Description and Artist Statement will be available to the jurors on their computer monitor and we ask that they read each one. Please use the Artist Statement to convey the process used to create your work and not the inspiration behind your artwork as that should speak for itself. Use your words well , get the message into one sentence that can be read quickly, it is so important for your jury score . Return to top Category Descriptions Work from production houses, co-ops, imported for resale, designed by the artist but not created by the artist and any other work not done by the artist will not be allowed. The use of AI in the creation of artwork must be disclosed in artist's application. Ceramics - Art objects either functional or decorative of earthenware, porcelain, or tile, made by shaping and then firing a nonmetallic mineral, such as clay, at a high temperature. Digital - Pictures made with the assistance of computers. Computer Graphics are often made with software called drawing, painting, illustrating and photographic programs or applications. This category does not include artwork created with AI. Drawing/Pastels - Drawings are works on paper using pencil, crayon, ink, charcoal, pastels and a variety of other marking media. Fiber - Includes non-wearable artwork from fibers such as basketry, embroidery, weaving, tapestry and papermaking. Glass - The expression of art made from blowing, fusing or other manipulation of glass. Graphics/Printmaking - Printmaking is a transfer process of producing original art, usually in multiples. It involves creating a drawing or other composition on a surface other than paper, for transfer to paper through the use of a press or through impressions made by hand. Jewelry - Ornaments, such as bracelets, necklaces, or rings. Made of precious metals set with gems or semi-precious gems or ceramic or glass or any other product. Metalworks - Creating artwork through the forging, twisting and fabricating of various metals. Mixed Media - Includes any combination of a variety of materials to create an original work of art. This artwork may be 2-D or 3-D. Painting: Oil/Acrylic - Creation of a still life, portrait, landscape, abstract or other image on a flat surface, such as canvas, with oil and/or acrylic paint or sticks. Painting: Watercolor - Creation of a still life, portrait, landscape, abstract or other image on a flat surface with watercolors. Photography - Process of capturing images of objects by the action of light, then printing the images, by chemical or digital means, onto a flat surface. Sculpture - Shaping figures or design in the round or in relief by chiseling marble, creating glass or clay or metal structures, integrating or casting metal or similar concepts. Wearable - Includes clothing or leather goods, such as belts or purses, that can be worn. Wood - Art objects either functional or decorative that may be hand-tooled or machine worked in wood. Back in 2026: Emerging Artists “At ArtFest Fort Myers, we believe in the power of emerging artists to shape the future of the arts. Our Emerging Artist Program is an exciting, hands-on mentoring journey designed to lift new talents into the spotlight. We’re here to champion the next generation of art show artists — providing them with the skills, support, and real-world experience they need to launch thriving careers. Through ArtFest Fort Myers, emerging artists don’t just exhibit — they grow, they connect, and they become part of a vibrant creative legacy!” The first year is Education and Internship Participate in free workshops including financial planning, portfolio reviews, art show booth displays, and pricing work. Apprentice to a Professional Artist at the Art Fair. In the second year, this next generation of artists will have the opportunity to show their work: Highlights of this year include: Shared space inside our Emerging Artist Tent Personal financial planning Personal application consultation. Requirements: Resides in Lee County. If not a local resident, must be willing to travel to Fort Myers and provide their own housing during the festival. Has not participated in a major juried art festival. Must be 18 or older to participate in this program. College or University is not required. Return to top Reproduction Policy To foster an appreciation and value of the arts in all people, including those who cannot afford original work, offering attendees the opportunity to buy reproductions is essential. As their incomes grow, they will turn to original work. This transition is possible only if buyers understand precisely what they are buying and the process behind it. Therefore, ArtFest Fort Myers' guidelines are as follows: All reproductions must be clearly and individually labeled as such. Labels must say "Reproduction."  This will include any framed reproductions. Reproductions must be in signed and numbered editions. No hand-colored reproductions or enhanced reproductions will be considered "original" works; they will be regarded as reproductions Reproductions must be an ancillary part of the artist's display. Violators of the spirit and the letter of this policy will be asked to remove their unlabeled reproductions. In any dispute, the decision of the Executive Director shall prevail. Return to top Eligibility and Rules All work must be done solely by the displaying artists. ArtFest Fort Myers takes seriously its responsibility to exclude work not done by the artist - such as production house work or buy-sell work. Acceptance into ArtFest Fort Myers is non-transferable. Only artwork of the accepted artist may be displayed. Artwork must be original in design, and an artist may display and sell only in the media category in which his work has been accepted. Work displayed and sold at ArtFest Fort Myers must be consistent with work represented by jury images. Artists are prohibited from displaying or selling non-original promotional items (i.e., posters, postcards, note cards, calendars, t-shirts, etc.) at the festival. Commercial agents, dealers, manufacturers, or buy-sell vendors are not eligible to enter, nor can they be proxies for artists. Artwork produced with kits, castings from commercial molds, patterns, plans, or other commercial means is prohibited. No work by apprentices or employees will be accepted. Work from production houses, co-ops, imported for resale, designed by the artist but not created by the artist and any other work not done by the artist will not be allowed. The use of AI in the creation of artwork must be disclosed in artist's application. Tent Rental: Artist desiring to rent a tent and/or booth setup may do so only through Tents4Events - they supply artist-style tents and equipment. No other tent rental companies are allowed. Artist must notify ArtFest Fort Myers that they are using a rental tent through Tents4Events . Collaborators: If two or more persons collaborate to produce original work, each person must be identified on the application. Collaborations are to be true artistic collaboration rather than business collaboration. For example, framing or printing work does not constitute a creative partnership. Therefore, individuals involved in those processes should not be listed on the application as a partner or collaborator. Sales Tax: Artists are responsible for collecting and paying 6.5% of Florida sales tax. Lee County is the collection area. Liability insurance: Artists are responsible for procuring and maintaining their liability insurance and must provide ArtFest Fort Myers with a Certificate of Insurance must name ArtFest For Myers as Additional Insured (wording shown below) by the deadline and stated above under the heading "Deadlines and Fees." Withdrawal: Artists may withdraw from ArtFest Fort Myers and receive a refund of their Booth Fee (less $85) if a written request is received on or before the deadline specified above under the heading "Deadlines and Fees." No refunds will be issued after that date. ArtFest Fort Myers is a rain-or-shine festival. No refunds will be issued for weather, pandemics or other acts of God. On-site at ArtFest Fort Myers : Artists and all collaborating partners must be present on-site with their booths for business during the festival. If two names are on the application, both must check in, show photo ID, and be present for the festival. Artists must confine their setup to the space allocated by ArtFest Fort Myers and not infringe on neighboring artists' space or pedestrian/vehicle passage space. Space allocations are based on Fire Marshall rules, and no infringements will be tolerated. This has always been our policy, but it is now necessary to add it to the written rules for enforcement. Original art must occupy at least 50% of the artist's wall space. All artwork on walls must be framed or otherwise professionally hung. Browse bins may occupy only minimal space and must be aesthetically pleasing and not obstruct patron flow. All artwork displayed must be for sale. Limited edition, signed, and numbered reproductions of artwork are allowed. Artists must define "limited edition" in their Artist Information Statement and disclose their reproduction process to buyers. Artists must display an Artist Information Statement in a prominent place within their booth. Materials and processes used must be disclosed in this statement. Displaying ribbons and awards from previous shows or other shows is not allowed. Artists must comply with all safety requirements, including weighted tents, and vehicles must be parked only in designated areas. No artist-owned animals are allowed in or around Artists' booths. Artists sitting in a chair outside their booth in attendee walking areas must use High Chairs Only! Having a lower-type chair in the way of attendee traffic is a tripping hazard and safety concern. This has always been our policy, but it is now necessary to add it to the written rules for enforcement. Artists must park in designated Artist Parking only - it is nearby and has trolley service to and from the lot. Artists cannot park their vans, trailers, RV, or similar within two blocks of the entrance areas or perimeter of the festival site at any time over the festival weekend or during setup and breakdown preparation. This is a Homeland Security issue for the perimeter of an outdoor event as large as ArtFest Fort Myers. The Festival perimeter area will be monitored for artist vans, trucks, etc., close to the festival site. If an artist's vehicle is found within the festival's defined perimeter, they will be notified to move their vehicle, or the vehicle will be towed. Return to top Welcome, Artists!
